({{TSXV|TNG}}) is a company specialized in video game [[Porting|portability technology]]. The company has its head office in [[Toronto]] and a research hub in [[Ottawa]]. It was founded by Gavriel State, who ran the [[Linux]] product division at the [[Corel Corporation]].{{cite web|url=http://www.transgaming.com/about/boardofdirectors/ |title=Board of Directors |publisher=TransGaming |accessdate=2009-01-04}} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=H3llBot}} The current CEO is Vikas Gupta. == Products == === Cider === TransGaming's flagship product called Cider is a technology marketed towards developers that allows [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] games to run on [[Mac OS X]]. It shares much of the same core technology as Cedega but is designed for video game designers and publishers. At the 2007 World Wide Developer Conference (WWDC07), Electronic Arts announced their return to the Mac, publishing various titles simultaneously on both PCs and Macs, using Cider on the Mac.[http://www.appleinsider.com/articles/07/06/11/eas_new_mac_games_will_demand_intel_based_systems.html AppleInsider | EA's new Mac games will demand Intel-based systems] In a newsletter dated 2007-11-13, the company announced that Cider's improvements will be merging back into Cedega.{{cite web|url=http://www.cedega.com/theden/?p=6 |title=The Den |format=Members only |work=Cedega |publisher=TransGaming |date= |accessdate=2009-01-04}} === GameTree Linux === {{Main|Cedega (software)}} GameTree Linux is a developer program dedicated to the further developement of [[Cedega (software)|Cedega]], which is a compatibility layer for running [[Microsoft Windows]] games on [[Linux]]. There are games that run on Cedega but not on Wine, and games that run on Wine but not Cedega. Users that want to play a specific game usually look for it on the games databases available on the web.{{cite web|url=http://appdb.winehq.org/ |title=Wine Application Database |publisher=WineHQ.org |accessdate=2011-10-15}}{{cite web|url=http://www.cedegawiki.net/Welcome_to_the_GameTree_Linux_Wiki |title=GameTree Linux Wiki |work=Cedega |accessdate=2011-10-15}} The source code for the program is available, but there are restrictions on redistribution that make it non-free software. === GameTree Mac === {{Expand section|date=July 2011}} [http://gametreemac.com GameTreeMac.com] was launched in Beta, March 2008, with a focus to offer the Mac gaming community an online retail distribution point for published Mac titles. === SwiftShader === {{Expand section|date=July 2011}} SwiftShader is an advanced software renderer with Direct3D 8/9 class features, including shaders. === Studio === In 2009 TransGaming Technologies launched a game development studio. Their first product was [[Armin van Buuren â In The Mix]] for the Nintendo Wii console. In November 2010, a new game was announced, entitled [[Garage Inc. (video game)|Garage Inc.]].{{cite web|url=http://www.transgaming.com/news/transgaming-studios-soon-release-garage-inc-across-multiple-platforms |title=Transgaming Studios Soon To Release âGarage Inc.â Across Multiple Platforms |publisher=TransGaming |accessdate=2010-10-18}} === GameTree TV === {{Expand section|date=July 2011}} [[GameTree TV]] is a games platform for consumer electronic devices using the Intel CE media processors. It was revealed in January 2010. == Digital rights management (DRM) == In a press release dated 2008-08-20, TransGaming announced that they "will utilize Sony DADC's [[SecuROM]] [[digital rights management]] (DRM) solution for all video game titles enabled through TransGaming's Cider portability engine for Mac games."{{cite web | url=http://www.transgaming.com/news/?id=108 | title=TransGaming to Utilize Sony DADC's SecuROM Technology | date=2008-08-20 | publisher=TransGaming Inc. | accessdate=September 6, 2008 }} TransGaming's use of SecuROM is notable because of the company's decision to use SecuROM technology for all Mac games enabled through Cider, irrespective of distribution channel (download vs. retail) and whether SecuROM was used for a game's Windows PC release.{{cite web | url=http://www.developmag.com/news/30391/Cider-powered-games-to-get-SecuROM-DRM | title=Cider-powered games to get SecuROM DRM | date=2008-08-22 | publisher=Develop Magazine | accessdate=September 6, 2008 }}{{cite web | url=http://www.insidemacgames.com/news/story.php?ID=16897 | title=TransGaming Adds SecuROM To Ciderized Titles | date=2008-08-21 | publisher=Inside Mac Games | accessdate=September 6, 2008 }} == See also == {{Portal|Video games}} * [[CrossOver]] * [[Wine (software)]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.transgaming.com TransGaming Technologies] * [http://home.businesswire.com/portal/site/google/index.jsp?ndmViewId=news_view&newsId=20070611006142&newsLang=en TransGaming to Develop EA Titles for MAC OS X] {{DEFAULTSORT:Transgaming Technologies}} [[Category:Video game companies of Canada]] [[Category:Companies based in Toronto]] [[Category:Companies established in 2001]] [[Category:Linux companies]] [[sv:TransGaming Technologies]]
